reviewText: This is a great movie because it's about one of my heroes. It is a very interesting account of the obstacles that Senator Dallaire faced in Rwanda, and this character is nothing like the Nick Nolte character in Hotel Rwanda in the sense that he is very lovable, gentle, and human. He is my definition of a genuine hero because he showed true courage in the face of calamity. He did what a real man is supposed to do: stick around when the going gets tough. Unfortunately, his health was at stake. I love that he approves of this film. I know because I watched the special features of this film, and I watched him discuss this film with Roy Dupuis on Youtube. Hollywood doesn't always present a true account of historical events, but this is a great film to get. It's independent. I prefer this one to Hotel Rwanda. Roy Dupuis did a great job in portraying the senator. I rooted for him as will many viewers who care about the necessity of saving lives. The world needs more people like this amazing individual. This film is a must-have, and I highly recommend it to everyone.
Title: N/A

reviewText: POWERFUL!!!This movie was wonderfully made. I am currently enrolled in a Human Relation class in college. This movie has help me make more sense of the subject than the teacher. Beautiful landscape. I have read other reviews that stated the movie was hard to watch, even some said it was depressing. I didn't feel that. It proved that one man could help change the world. I have watched 4 times so far.

reviewText: The subject matter was hard to watch at times but it was based on true events.  You just realize how much is political in the real world when you watch a show such as this one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This ranks just above Hotel Rawanda in telling the horrific story of the Rawandan genocide of the Tutsis by the Hutu.  It really gives you an idea of what went on and how badly the rest of the world and the United Nations responded to this disaster.  The performances are great throughout the film and the story it weaves about the commanding general of the UN forces and his efforts is a very powerful piece of film making.  You won't enjoy this film but it will stir your emotions and give you some insight in to what goes on in the rest of the world.This is not for kids!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I wasn't sure what to expect of this film about the genocide in Rwanda, but it was much better than I anticipated. The primary reason for my 5 star rating is the performance of Roy Dupuis as General Romeo Dallaire the man in charge of the UN mission to keep peace in the country. Dupuis (Le Femme Nikita), just inherits this role and displays all the insanity, confusion, and stupidity of the UN while trying to be a 'peacekeeper' in a country where that is just impossible. This is not a 'shoot em up' film but it is very, very violent and hard to watch. If the complex job of a professional soldier is at all of interest to you, this film will be well worth your time.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This movie ia a true to life movie That is a part of Rawanda's history and will not be forgotten. Roy Dupuis played the general so well and was on point about the way the script should go. I always enjoy watching Roy onscreen. The story is a sad one. It is my hope that this never happens again, so many lives were lost. The movie is worth watching and it will make you cry.

reviewText: This is not an enjoyable movie as other reviewers have stated, but it should be watched and reflected upon.I think that if you are unfamiliar to this topic, or new event from Rwanda, and are interested in human rights issues this is a great docudrama that depicts the events that recently occurred. It is a true statement of the disgraceful responses from UN politicians and the bravery of a Canadian soldier in command whom despite all odds and all advice did what he knew was best for humanity. He did have followers so we need to credit them as well - but the world could have prevented a slaughter of almost a million people and decided to pull troops out in a time of need.How can such illleadership take place then and now? This is not a Hollywood flick for entertainment - but what should be seen as an ignorant and embarrassing slip from modern society. Totally preventable and most around the globe unaware.We owe it to the future to become more aware of such events, and we should question what we are seeing. If you doubt this we should research it. If we find that there are lies and discrepancies with what we see we should report it (in reviews like this) but when you read on and find truth - we should tell what we see as a critical lesson for the world to be aware of.
summary: an ignorant and embarrassing slip from modern society
Title: N/A

reviewText: Tru story about the killing fields of Rwanda - and hte valient efforts of the Cnadian leader of the UN forces to try and stop it without any support from higher ups in the UN or any major government.Gun shy after the recent Somalia episode (Black Hawk Down), the UN was in no frame of mind to send in troops to stop this killing.  In fact the ones that were on the ground were short on ammunition and barely able to defend themselves - which at times they could not even do that.France does not come across well - more interested in their slice of the pie than protecting innocent people.Even after all his efforts - the Canadian and Dutch commanders ended up being punished by their own governments unjustly for what occured in Rwanda.  I believe one of them was court-martialed for something that occured out of his control; pure politics.Sad, but worthwhile movie.
summary: Sad Piece of History - A Stain Upon the UN

reviewText: Having lived in Africa, and served in the military through two conflicts, I can only say this movie left me flattened.  A masterpiece that makes Hotel Rwanda, a powerful movie in its own right, seem downright "Hollywood".A must watch movie with unparalleled intensity and realism. For an Afro-centric view, I recommend watching Sometime in April.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's hard to say that this movie is good entertainment when the subject matter is so appalling and horrific and yet, it is an excellent historic portrayal that should be required viewing in every school and university the world over! SHAKE HANDS WITH THE DEVIL is the story of how the world let down Rwanda and how one determined UN Canadian Army General and a small contingent of UN soldiers did everything they could to stop the genocide that occured there.Roy DuPuis does an amazing job as Lt.General Romeo Dallaire, the Canadian Army General in charge of the UN Peacekeeping force under the spot of work of Director Roger Spottswoode and those who put this powerful story on film. Shot in Rwanda where the actual events took place the film offers up powerful visuals as well.Dallaire and those who stayed on to protect those they could after being order to leave are the kind of heroes we need to celebrate and admire, for their service and for the terrible price that each paid, after they were ordered to leave by UN officials.There are those who serve honorably in conflicts and those who do not. Dullaire and the soldiers who braved overwhelming odds are the former and the world powers and the UN officials represent the latter.I strongly encourage you to see this movie.
summary: The History We Need to Know
Title: N/A
